entry.value: Shows how to set a custom HTML page as the node view.

import knime.scripting.io as knio%%00010%%00010# This example uses an HTML string as the output view%%00010knio.output_view = knio.view("""<!DOCTYPE html>%%00010<html>%%00010 <body>%%00010 My HTML view%%00010 </body>%%00010</html>%%00010""")%%00010%%00010# Views can also be created from other objects like bytes containing a PNG or JPEG image,%%00010# or strings containing an SVG. Also, many objects that can be displayed in jupyter notebooks%%00010# can be displayed as an output view automatically. See the documentation of knio.view for%%00010# more information.
